properties.prefix:
Archaeology Site


  • There are specific field-sets for recommended aspects of description. The “type” sub-field is used to fine tune the meaning, the “value” sub-field is used to indicate a key-word or phrase for that aspect, and the “note” sub-field is used for a longer text which amplifies the meaning or indicates a special consideration.

  • If there is no specific field-set for your purpose, use “keyword” for typed descriptive words or phrases and “note” for typed descriptive texts.

properties.description: The required name, label or formal title of the archaeological site being described. This is the primary way of naming this archaeological site in the system.
properties.title: Site Title

properties.description: Use this if there are other names or titles associated with the archaeological site in the context of your research.
properties.title: Alternate Titles

properties.description: The type of title such as Abbreviation or Other Title.
properties.title: Alternate Title Type

properties.description: Alternate name, label or formal title of the Site being described.
properties.title: Alternate Title

properties.description: This is a general description or abstract about what you know about the archaeological site.
properties.title: Summary Description

properties.description: Keywords, subject terms, key phrases classification codes, etc., ideally drawn from a thesaurus, which classifies or describes the archaeological site and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Keywords

properties.description: The type of keyword, such as Subject, Geographic or Temporal. Leaving type blank would imply general keywords.
properties.title: Keyword Type

properties.description: Formal strings of characters that are used to uniquely identify the archaeological site in various systems. This can also be used to create a formal identifier for the archaeological site for your project.
properties.title: Identifiers

properties.description: The name of the system or standard for which the identifier was created.
properties.title: Identifier Type

properties.description: The value of the identifier.
properties.title: Identifier

properties.description: Other entities that are related to the archaeological site, such as the name of a larger archaeological site or entity of which the archaeological site being described is or was a part.
properties.title: Relations

properties.description: The type of relationship.
properties.title: Relationship Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the relationship being described.
properties.title: Relationship Notes

properties.description: General notes that provide descriptions for other aspects relevant to your understanding of the archaeological site, and for which there are no more specific fields in the form.
properties.title: Notes

properties.description: The type of note such as Excavation Notes, General Notes, etc.
properties.title: Note Type

properties.description: This can be used to register specific dates associated with the archaeological site, such as the time period it was excavated, the year it was originally inhabited, etc.
properties.title: Time Periods

properties.description: The type of time period such as “excavation” or “habitation".
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date associated with the site being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the time period being described.
properties.title: Time Period Notes

properties.description: The spatial location of the site. This section can be used to describe the formal geometry of the archaeological site being described, such as a central point, boundary box or polygon of points that define its boundary.
properties.title: Place Information

properties.description: The type of place being described such as, Site location.
properties.title: Place Type

properties.description: Name of a geographic location pertaining to the site being described e.g. Country, Province, Region, etc.
properties.title: Geographic Areas

properties.description: The Geographic Coordinates for the place being described.
properties.title: Geographic Coordinates

properties.description: This is used to identify the time period during which the geometry is relevant to the archaeological site.
properties.title: Place Time Period

properties.description: The type of time period being described.
properties.title: Time Period Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the place being described.
properties.title: Numeric Dates

properties.description: The type of numeric date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place dates being described.
properties.title: Place Time Period Notes

properties.description: A brief note pertaining to the place being described.
properties.title: Place Notes

properties.description: This is used to identify people or organizations that have a special relationship to the archaeological site. For example, the person who directed or participated in the excavation, or an organization that sponsored or funded it.
properties.title: Related People and Organizations

properties.description: The role of the person related to the archaeological site, such as “director” or “owner”.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the person.
properties.title: Person Name

properties.description: The role of the organization in relation to the site such as the Sponsoring or Funding Organization.
properties.title: Role

properties.description: The name of the organization.
properties.title: Organization Name

properties.description: This is used to classify and/or describe the physical characteristics of an archaeological site.
properties.title: Physical Description

properties.description: The type of physical thing being described such as terrain, stratigraphy, etc.
properties.title: Physical Description Type

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the physical description being described.
properties.title: Physical Description Notes

properties.description: The type of site Condition being described.
properties.title: Condition Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the condition.
properties.title: Condition

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the condition being described.
properties.title: Condition Notes

properties.description: This is used to describe the background or meaning of an archaeological site, such as its religious or historical context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: The type of Context being described such as Cultural, Religious, etc.
properties.title: Context Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the context.
properties.title: Context

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the context being described.
properties.title: Context Notes

properties.description: For physical entities, what it is made of.
properties.title: Materials

properties.description: The type of Material being described.
properties.title: Material Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the material pertaining to a site.
properties.title: Material

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the materials being described.
properties.title: Material Notes

properties.description: Explanatory text on the method used in relation to a site.
properties.title: Methods

properties.description: The type of methods used in relation to the site such as method of excavation.
properties.title: Method Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the method used.
properties.title: Method

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the method being described.
properties.title: Method Notes

properties.description: Describes the techniques used in relation to a site.
properties.title: Techniques

properties.description: The type of techniques used.
properties.title: Technique Type

properties.description: Brief text describing the technique.
properties.title: Technique

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the technique being described.
properties.title: Techniques Notes

properties.description: Either a textual or formal numeric description of the dimensions of an archaeological site, such as area in square meters.
properties.title: Measurements

properties.description: This is for cases where the measurements are just a string of text. For example, “L 12 inches; H 6 inches”.
properties.title: Measurement Text

properties.description: A measurement intended to be a single dimension using a combination of the type, value and units attributes.
properties.title: Numeric Measurement

properties.description: The type of measurement such as depth, circumference, length, width or height.
properties.title: Measurement Type

properties.description: The value of the measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Value

properties.description: Unit of measurement such as feet, inches, centimeters, etc.
properties.title: Measurement Unit

properties.description: The dates pertaining to a measurement.
properties.title: Measurement Dates

properties.description: The type of Date associated with the measurement.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: A time period name, e.g. "the 20th Century", "Mesozoic Era".
properties.title: Textual Date

properties.description: A specific numeric date or dates associated with the site being described.
properties.title: Numeric Date

properties.description: The type of numeric date such as begin date or end date.
properties.title: Date Type

properties.description: Explanatory text on the accuracy of the set of measurements.
properties.title: Measurement Accuracy

properties.description: Notes pertaining to the measurement being described.
properties.title: Measurement Notes
